summary: the coverage rate of influenza vaccination was suboptimal at 8.5 % in 2012/13. cases were adults aged 50–64 years who had received the influenza vaccine in 2011/12 or 2012/13. controls were the same as the cases, except they had not received the influenza vaccine in 2011/12 or 2012/13. the perception of the severity of symptoms when contracting influenza had a comparatively strong association with influenza vaccination uptake amongst 50–64 year olds.
